summary.p: 394 fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: K. 378; Qurʾānic Text: unclear; 11 lines per page; Dimensions: 210 x 275mm; Script style: ṯuluṯ.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 29: "88 K. 378. Aynı. Aharlı esmer kâğıt. 275mm boy ve 210mm eninde 394 yaprak. Sahifede harekeli Arap sülüsü ile 160mm uzunl.[uğunda] 11 satır. Tahminen Mezopotamyada VI-VII. (XII-XIII) asırlarda kopya edilmişir. Baştan 5, sondan 2 yaprağı sonradan yazılmıştır. Sure başları, duraklar, güller kırmızı ile. Miklep ve şemseli kırmızı deri ve ebru cilt."

This can be translated as follows: "88 K. 378. Same. Sized brown paper. 394 leaves of 275 mm height and 210 mm width. The text area written in thuluth script with diacritics, [contains] 11 lines measuring 160 mm height. Probably copied during the 6th - 7th (12th -13th) century. First 5 and last 2 leaves are written later. Sūra beginnings, verse seperators, and roses are in red. Red leather binding with flap (miklep), mandorla (şemse) and marbling (ebru).”
